CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. The decrease of series resistance could increase FF. PQCDTB showed high FF than PCZDTB due to decrease of series resistance by self - organization of quinacridone unit. 9 Figure 5b showed the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) data of the fabricated device. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. The photovoltaic devices with PC71BM as an acceptor showed higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor , although they absorbed photons in the same range of the solar spectra. This was because PC71BM has a stronger UV - vis absorption property than does PC61BM in the visible region , especially near 500 nm. 30 Hence , the PCE improved with an increase in J SC . In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PQCDTB (Poly-quinacridone) - mentioned in the paragraph as the donor material in the devices.
2. PC61BM (Poly-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester) - mentioned as an acceptor material in the devices.
3. PC71BM (Poly-[7,7]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester) - mentioned as an acceptor material in the devices, which shows improved photovoltaic performance compared to PC61BM.
4. P3HT (Poly-3-hexylthiophene) - mentioned as a reference donor material with a higher open-circuit voltage (V oc) than PQCDTB.
5. FF (Fill Factor) - mentioned as a parameter that describes the ratio of the active area of the solar cell to the total area of the cell.
6. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) - mentioned as a parameter that describes the efficiency of the solar cell in converting incident light into electrical energy.
7. EQE (External Quantum Efficiency) - mentioned as a parameter that describes the efficiency of the solar cell in converting incident light into electrical energy, measured at the device's external quantum efficiency.
8. λ max (Lambda maximum) - mentioned as the wavelength at which the solar cell has the highest external quantum efficiency.

These are the "Material Name" entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PQCDTB (Poly-quinacridone)
2. PC61BM (Poly-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)
3. PC71BM (Poly-[7,7]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester)

These are the only entities in the paragraph that are clearly referring to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities referring to "Material Name" in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Materials used as donors:
 * PQCDTB (Poly-[2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylato]-1,4-phenylene-vinylene)
 * PCZDTB (Poly[2,6-diacetyl-1,4-phenylene-vinylene])
 * PC61BM (Poly[6,6-difluoro-2,2-dimethyl-4,4-dicyanovinylene-alt-phenylene])
 * PC71BM (Poly[7,7-difluoro-2,2-dimethyl-4,4-dicyanovinylene-alt-phenylene])
2. Materials used as acceptors:
 * PC61BM
 * PC71BM
3. Other materials:
 * HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) level
 * LOMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) level
 * FF (Fill Factor)
 * V OC (Open-Circuit Voltage)
 * J SC (Short-Circuit Current)
 * PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
 * EQE (External Quantum Efficiency)
 * λ max (Maximum Wavelength of Light Absorbed)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to the property names of materials in the paragraph:

1. PQCDTB (Poly-[2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylato]-1,4-phenylene-vinylene)
2. PCZDTB (Poly[2,6-diacetyl-1,4-phenylene-vinylene])
3. PC61BM (Poly[6,6-difluoro-2,2-dimethyl-4,4-dicyanovinylene-alt-phenylene])
4. PC71BM (Poly[7,7-difluoro-2,2-dimethyl-4,4-dicyanovinylene-alt-phenylene])

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Open-circuit voltage (V OC):
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC61BM: 0.76 V

2. Short-circuit current (J SC):
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC61BM: 4.4 mA cm^-2
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC71BM: 5.6 mA cm^-2
3. Fill factor (FF):
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC61BM: 47.5%
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC71BM: 55.8%
4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE):
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC61BM: 1.6%
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC71BM: 56% (approximately)
5. HOMO level (Eg):
 * PQCDTB: -5.53 eV
 * P3HT: -4.9 eV
6. Series resistance (Rs):
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC61BM: 31 Ω/cm^2
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC71BM: 27 Ω/cm^2
 * Device with PCZDTB and PC61BM: 320 Ω/cm^2
 * Device with PCZDTB and PC71BM: 62 Ω/cm^2
7. External quantum efficiency (EQE):
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC61BM: 38% at 480 nm
 * Device with PQCDTB and PC71BM: 41% at 480 nm
 * Device with PCZDTB and PC61BM: 48% at 440 nm
